main event: Three aerial objects were sighted by officers of the S.S. Antigua in the vicinity of San Andres Islands in the Caribbean Sea on February 6, 1949.
interesting points: The first object was described as a round silver-colored sphere, changing color from silver to yellow to red as it passed overhead., The objects were estimated to be 12 to 14 inches in diameter., The sighting occurred between 1630 and 1700 local time and was made from a ship traveling from New Orleans to the Canal Zone., Two other objects were also sighted at higher altitudes but were not luminous., There is a possibility that the objects were weather balloons released from two Russian sloops in the area.
witness description: officers aboard the S.S. Antigua, a United Fruit vessel
